channel.title: I need a helping hand :|
channel.description:
hey guys, been a while since i've done rsps and have decided to begin hosting my own server again... here is my problem: i have portfowarded and i have got no-ip set up etc.. and the status checker says my server is online as well. anyway, when i go to login to the server i get this error spamming my server runner: [IMG]http://i44.tinypic.com/sligll.png[/img] but if i just login via localhost (0.0.0.0/127.0.0.1), it logs me into the server fine.... any ideas? thanks (: (Also if it helps i have windows 7 which i did not have last time..)
--James--

item.title: I need a helping hand :|
item.dc:creator: @jamessemple jamessemple
item.description:
@jamessemple wrote:

well dude thanks, but i am aware of this the question i am asking is… why is it doing so? btw it is my connection so ye…

Read full topic

item.title: I need a helping hand :|
item.dc:creator: @surfer25 surfer25
item.description:
@surfer25 wrote:

Please realise that I do know what I’m talking about. It means the connection from another address not YOUR own terminated abruptly and the client tried to reset the connection.

Read full topic

item.title: I need a helping hand :|
item.dc:creator: @jamessemple jamessemple
item.description:
@jamessemple wrote:

surfer25:

It just means the player who was on closed his client while you were downloading data from him… Its completely normal

did you even read my post? don’t post shit you don’t know… please…

Read full topic

item.title: I need a helping hand :|
item.dc:creator: @jamessemple jamessemple
item.description:
@jamessemple wrote:

K i couldn’t spot a print in from that method unless u mean the shutdown printout message so i’ll post the whole void.

[code]
public void run() {

	// we just accepted a new connection - handle the login stuff
	isActive = false;
	long serverSessionKey = 0, clientSessionKey = 0;

	// randomize server part of the session key
	serverSessionKey = ((long) (java.lang.Math.random() * 99999999D) << 32)
			+ (long) (java.lang.Math.random() * 99999999D);

	try {
		fillInStream(2);
		if (inStream.readUnsignedByte() != 14) {
			mySock.close();
			shutdownError("Expected login Id 14 from client.");
			disconnected = true;
			return;
		}[/code]

now what from here? (:

Read full topic

item.title: I need a helping hand :|
item.dc:creator: @the_soul The Soul
item.description:
@the_soul wrote:

[quote=“jamessemple, post:6, topic:337925”]private void fillInStream(int forceRead) throws java.io.IOException { inStream.currentOffset = 0; in.read(inStream.buffer, 0, forceRead); //in.readFully(inStream.buffer, 0, forceRead);//in.read(inStream.buffer, 0, forceRead); }
k now what? :[/quote]

Show the line in the run() method that’s being printed.

Read full topic

item.title: I need a helping hand :|
item.dc:creator: @jamessemple jamessemple
item.description:
@jamessemple wrote:

poison blood:

maybe its the source you are useing? i’ve had that problem although it wasnt realy a problem, its just how your server (source) runs. - its when it wont let you sign on and keeps doing that, that would be a problem lol

ok, thank you for the suggestion but do you really think I’m that stupid? i tried several different sources and clients including the ones that i used to use before i stopped for a while.

hey guys, been a while since i’ve done rsps and have decided to begin hosting my own server again…
here is my problem: i have portfowarded and i have got no-ip set up etc… and the status checker says my server is online as well. anyway, when i go to login to the server i get this error spamming my server runner:

sligll.png768×480
